results.title: Domestic angels: the pros and cons
results.creator_credit: Joanne Bell and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: The luck of a taxi driver improves when an angel unexpectedly drops in. Cast includes Nigel Cox, James Wardlow, Malcolm Darby, Dennis Scullen, Mary Casey. Cinematography by Ray Boseley.

results.title: Dom Juan
results.brief_description:
The central character of Dom Juan is the anti-hero, a brilliant, irresponsible villain, an amourous libertine who receives his comeuppance by refusing to repent.

Credits: Director, Marcel Bluwal ; photography, Andre Bac ; music, Mozart.
Cast: Claude Brasseur, Michel Piccoli, Anouk Ferjac, Dominique Rosan, Michel Le Royer.

results.title: Dolores from 10 to 10
results.brief_description:
Dolores from 10 to 10 is a multi-channel installation, adapted from Fusco and Ricardo Dominguez’s 12-hour performance at Kiasma in Helsinki, which was streamed live to the internet in 2001. The work refers to the true story of a maquiladora (assembly line) worker, falsely accused of unionizing workers at her plant. Locked in an office for 12 hours without food, water, or telephone access, she was coerced into signing a letter of resignation. Her lawsuit against her employers was eventually denied on the grounds that she had no ‘proof’.

Dolores from 10 to 10 is Fusco’s interpretation of this real-life internment and a re-construction of what might have been seen if there had been surveillance cameras in the office. Framed by the female labour situation in Mexico, Fusco highlights the inequalities of the relationship between women and technology across the world.

results.title: Dolly
results.creator_credit: Igor Ageev, Isaac Fridberg and Mosfilm
results.brief_description: Tanya is a brilliant gymnast. Selected while still a small child to be given the training needed to be an international champion, she grows up in an atmosphere of tense and unfriendly rivalry, arrogance and a desire to win at all costs. Disaster strikes at the age of fourteen when an injury brings her career to an end and she is shunted off into the normal world. A controversial and powerful drama about the Soviet system of making and breaking sporting champions. Based on a story by Igor Ageev.

results.title: Dolls of many lands
results.brief_description: Shows dolls exhibited at an international fair and now permanently housed in a famous collection in Italy. The dolls are dressed in folk costumes and are shown in settings which closely resemble some characteristic natural background of the doll’s native land. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Dolls (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: G.A. Howe, Pre-School Education Project and MacMillan Film Productions
results.brief_description: Indicates how realistic play with dolls helps children learn about human relationships and come to terms with babies in their own families. The class watches while a child’s mother washes and dresses her baby and the children copy her with their dolls.

results.title: Dollars or decay
results.creator_credit: Department of Health Services and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Illustrates the consequences that a poor or bad diet has on teeth. Attention is especially drawn to food served in school tuckshops. Section on good nutrition habits and how to give children low cost healthy food that they like.

results.title: Dollar dance
results.brief_description: Wartime inflation and the role of price control are the subjects of this publicity trailer which employs single-frame animation of direct pen-drawing on 35mm film stock. McLaren featured an animated dancing dollar sign to encourage buying bonds, promote savings and warn of the dangers of inflation. The sound-track consists of spoken rhymed verses accompanied by an orchestra. Music Louis Applebaum.

results.title: Doled out
results.brief_description: A film about being unemployed and on the dole in Australia in 1978. In interviews and short dramatised sketches, the causes and effects of unemployment are examined in statements by people who are tired of being called “bludgers”. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Doing time for Patsy Cline
results.creator_credit: Chris Kennedy, John Winter and Oilrag Productions
results.brief_description: Ralph, a country boy who has just left his parents farm to seek fame and fortune as a country singer in Nashville, hitches a ride with a drug dealer, Boyd, and his girlfriend Patsy. Within 24 hours Boyd and Ralph are arrested and locked up in a country jail. Set against a background of country music and shifting between the present and Ralph’s daydreams, in which he fantasises about finding success in Nashville with the alluring Patsy, the film embraces the bittersweet pathos that characterises the country music genre. Cast includes Richard Roxburgh, Miranda Otto, Matt Day, Tony Barry and Kiri Paramore.
